FUz2-jff_JwXeM1ffdcgJw.text: Didn't Disappoint   If you're looking for great food options, reasonable prices, friendly service, and ambiance.  Then look no further, the Salty Sow is calling your name. The service at Salty Sow was amazing - our server never missed a beat and had a wonderful attitude and personality and the food was fabulous.   We started with appetizers,  Truffled Deviled Eggs, and Triple Fried Duck Fat Fries, one word, delicious. For our entrees I ordered the Fish and Chips and my dinner companion ordered the Pork over Mashed Potatoes. Both of us thoroughly enjoyed our dishes.  The meal ended with a decadent dessert, Bananas Foster Beignets, made with cane syrup, honey & nutmeg ice cream, amazing.  What a pleasurable dinning experience. I can't say enough about the Salty Sow. Definitely a place to visit when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VehH2QlZbJbnaQthxRvZ2w.text: We like to stop in here as a special treat when we're in the area. For an appetizer we love the Truffled Deviled Eggs. They are delicious! I've tried a number of different entrees here and my favorite is the Diroc Pork Belly. It's a must try! Served with greens and corn grits. It's absolutely delicious! The Prime Rib is also delicious, served with a side salad and matter Mashed Potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Complementary dessert for my birthday, the Butterscotch Budino w/biscotti. Amazing!
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prime Rib served with side salad and Mashed Potatoes.
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Duroc Pork Belly served with greens and Corn Grits. My favorite entree on the menu. Must try!

DxghtX21vsuzMf5ut_NG2g.text: They do many things right :) The service will make you smile :) The food is consistently great, lots of it from scratch !  Try the Brussel sprouts ! Salmon is awesome :)  The Pork dishes are the best !  Ask for a fresh biscuit -   The perfect fun night for a date -  Live acoustic music ! I think it's on Thurs and Sat -  an absolute must see - especially if you  appreciate great acoustic music.  OMG - perfect for a fun night, Will warm your heart :)  Go to the patio - plenty of heaters  and they keep you toasty and warm.   It's semi casual - but the food is first class.  Nice people working there - been there 5 times, always a smile from the staff -

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QoHetqTNERH8aOGOBmUNfg.text: First time I went here, it was awesome. Our server was great and the food was really excellent. The second time I went was not so great. Our server was nice, but she put in the wrong order for me, which was fine, I wasn't mad and told her just bring it when it's ready. My party and I were not in a hurry . But when I finally did get my food it was raw (I ordered the salmon). She apologized and made a comment about the cooks, something like, "did they rush it again? I told them not to rush it." So I'm assuming they've sent out under cooked food/salmon before. Now that everyone was done eating. I just decided to pass on getting another salmon or getting something else. The manager did comp my food and drink and offered a free dessert, which was nice. I will most likely go back again, I probably just won't order the salmon.

K9HdDLpMmwDWs12aUWLoZw.text: The restaurant is back to it's former fantastic self !!!!! I am so excited to see live music back , specials & wine & beer dinners !!!!!

XAxnWT4JoZ2XSAI3jE7xjw.text: I'm glad to have finally made it in.   Nice decor. Nice people. Clean throughout. Server was excellent and helpful.  Tried their double cut duroc pork rack and blackened ribeye tacos. Both are good value portion to price. Plated nicely. Pork rack with grits was very good. The ribeye was in tiny bits, very salty and over-seasoned. On the whole, good enough.  Ended with server-recommended bananas foster beignets. Awesome!  I'll be back. But not on a Thursday or Saturday. Live music nights. Not for me.

ux4Zx5K6Pus4mVCHGqpU9g.text: I came to the Salty Sow on Christmas Eve and it didn't fail to impress me or my family!   For the appetizer I had the truffled deviled eggs and they were really special. Extremely good flavor and really nicely whipped texture.   For dinner I had a really good brussel sprout caesar salad and shared fish and chips with my mom! The brussel sprouts in the salad were especially delicious and the dressing has a great kick! Proportions were the perfect size across the board.   They also had good apps, ambiance was very enjoyable and they had a great happy hour.   Will definitely come back again!

-BrsUcyMKL7OeFNtIUeQiw.text: I really love this place. Perfect for happy hour. I've always had great service, and the food is very consistent. I LOVE the truffled deviled eggs. And great pricing on happy wine and cocktails. I really wish there was another location close to Old Town Scottsdale or Tempe!

bNX_1j9l9xlpgxpdLBLYxg.text: Went for happy hour and got pretty much everything on that menu. Me and my friend tried the pork belly taco, spit roasted pork taco, duck fat fries, and the honey rosemary fried chicken. The tacos were not good- the pork belly taco had a single, thick strip of pork that was tough to chew, and the spit roasted pork taco has so much grits in it that it's all you taste (and the texture is not great). However, I still give 4 stars because the honey rosemary chicken was GREAT. Definitely order that! We each also had 2 cocktails- I had sangria, and a cocktail with rosemary in it (can't remember the name) both were excellent and had special prices for HH. The service was also great, our waitress checked on us multiple times and the food didn't take long.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EuoBMk0IwIsrEXSX9E4hkw.text: Great spot to relax & dine with family, friends and coworkers. Made reservations for a party of eight last minute and they were able to accommodate.  I had guests come in from Dallas and they absolutely loved the food!  Lots of indoor and outdoor seating.  Friendly staff, very attentive!

7Xkt2v_Almom3bubJRVqaw.text: Stopped in near the end of Happy Hour for an early dinner. The server Holly was great. She made sure I knew about Happy Hour and made a few suggestions for my meal. I ended up selecting the Filet which proved to be a good choice. The Filet was a perfect Med Rare as I ordered it and the shallot butter demi-glaze was great. The Yukon Gold Mash that accompanied it was solid. I am a huge fan of Onion Strings but was disappointed by there. They tasted a bit stale and lacked any really good flavor. I was able to overlook that because the Shallot Butter on the Steak was able to hit every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fillet

O1mN2QEsLL_m_TR3es6B1A.text: This is very chic and has great service. I have been there for Happy Hour with good live band and today I went for their Buffet Brunch, let me tell you how fantastic it was. They had a $4 mimosas bar and $6 Bloody Mary bar!!! Total awesomeness.   Their brunch buffet was very upscale, salmons, chicken, pork belly potatoes, great caesar salad, countless pastries... all hot and fresh! I really enjoyed  it.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oCbiKkr95RRoNj7O08qwmg.text: Beautiful decor and a nice feel to the place. We went for lunch and it was not crowded at all. One of the servers stood and talked to the customers at the table behind us for our entire meal. She was so loud that it was incredibly annoying. Somehow I doubt the customers had invited her to join them for lunch.  My husband said his burger was beautiful but had some grizzly chunks in it. My wine did not taste like the bottle had been opened today and at $9/glass for a $10/bottle value, it should have been better. Two stars for decor, an additional star because our server was OK. Probably too many other restaurant choices to return. Nothing incredible here.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ONFFkQbAJGIjcINzaZlvaA.text: I've had two - yes, two - visits to the Salty Sow for brunch. I can't comment on meals at any other time, but I must say I'm a huge fan of their brunch. There's something for everyone at this brunch - lighter fare, eggs and BBQ. I really appreciate how they make smaller portions and keep the food coming out freshly prepared. Here are a few of my favorites: On my first visit, the salmon and the brussel sprouts salad was the sure-fire winner. That salmon was butter-soft and lightly smoky. And that brussel sprouts salad is amazing: a combination of roasted & shaved brussel sprouts tossed with romaine lettuce. I can't stop eating it, it's so addictive. I also tried the roasted pork stuffed with pancetta and, well, a taste of pretty much everything. Our waiter insisted we place an order for biscuits and they are delivered to the table fresh and hot. They are the bomb. On my second visit, the stand out for me was by far the smoked turkey breast. Maybe it was because I took a slightly-thicker cut of the meat which kept it moister. (Note to chef, I wouldn't pre-slice those paper-thin slices of turkey - they just curl up and get dry). And, once again, that brussel sprouts salad won me over! My friends raved about the green chile pork stew, but it wasn't doing it for me that day.  For brunch, with $4 Mimosas or $5 Bloodies, with the range of amazing food and a casual "take your time and enjoy your meal" vibe, you cannot beat the Salty Sow. My "go to" place for special occasions.

EA1wOcDWJBz9D-MdwLZt-w.text: We had a wonderful experience at the Salty Sow. It is casual enough for a family after the game yet lovely enough for date night. The food was wonderful and the service - Charlie- was perfect. We will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Open air patio in the evening

WCVLtP1Cu2sw_D00rpiobw.text: We were served by Holly, who was VERY nice! I had gotten the goat cheese ravioli and it came out a bit cold, without hesitation Holly had taken care of the plate and requested a re-make. My girlfriend got the filet, and she was in love. Very juicy and tender, and the mashed potatoes were fire to say the least. Pleased to say I will return and I am happy I finally decided to try this place. Will be coming back

uGbbkAVRwHLRqcj8vtdCGg.text: Salty Sow has one of the best burgers in the Valley and their Brussels sprouts are out of this world! Great atmosphere, great happy hour, and great food.

Vsgghr0AEHIxhL0jwvKyBQ.text: Sure give us our side of cauliflower rice 10 min after our main course is served...said nobody ever.  Actually I had to ask them to stop the order because we were already done. Very frustrating.

3Wu27QRplPZuAElIteuhUA.text: This place had an interesting menu. If you like food that is different yet has a home cooked feel this place is great. The service was great as well. Loved the ambiance and atmosphere.   I was a little underwhelmed at a few things. The duck fries were delicious but I didn't care for the sauce. My husband liked it though. The goat cheese fritters were really good but the toast was a little bit TOO toasted. They're also HUGE and I prefer fritters smaller.   I ordered the Brussels sprouts Caesar. It was great. I really loved the flavor. It had a bit of bite to it. Would love to go back and try something new. But as for what I had this first time I wouldn't be dying to go back. I rated it so highly because it takes reservations which is so rare nowadays for moderately priced places.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Duck fries. The fries were so good! Wasn&#39;t crazy about the sauce.

InAD4pnFZJLC9neu0V9kbQ.text: We've been here twice now and have had only the most positive experiences.   For starters, our waiter, Michael, remembered us from our first visit ten months earlier. He's definitely a huge asset to this place. He was very attentive, gave us great honest suggestions, and is an overall pleasant person.   The food is also fantastic. It's clearly high quality and well prepared. There's nothing that we've had that we wouldn't have again.

HnraK3tRFPzcpUFvYroiFA.text: Fantastic food and reasonably priced. They had a solid menu of regular items that all sounded good. The specials were awesome.  I had chorizo stuffed mushrooms. They had the perfect level of spice. It comes with some crispy bread, dip it in the butter they cook the mushrooms in and its great. I had pineapple upside down cake that was phenomenal. The pineapple was fresh and plenty of crispy caramelized cake with some nice vanilla ice cream.   The prices are really good for as good a product as they put out. A+++ great drinks too. Had the margarita with Chambord and it was so good and so refreshing.  Great place for adults probably not great for little kids but the food and drink are tops.

foq9ZRi-_zngMWkcKVgSpg.text: I was out here on business and loved the restaurant so much, I ate here twice! I have eaten a lot of seafood, and have to say the Halibut is as Guy Fiorertti

hBclhsSD7Es6qrUIfTwS4A.text: The atmosphere is relaxing, the food is very delicious and the service is great!!! Definitely will be returning!

d4sUmhvdq9thPMR4zjaVpg.text: We have been regulars to the Sow since they opened their Phoenix restaurant.  This menu is for the adventurous and the hungry! Love the fried avocado with pulled BBQ pork and spicy fresca drizzled over the top. Smoked salmon toasts have a charred twist and pickled extras.  Their crispy chicken is perfect every time and their smashed roasted fingerlings are beautifully soft and crisp with bone marrow gravy smothering them to death.  Get excited for the giant pot that arrives to your table for the short rib entree. This dish is served cowboy style in a giant pot, with all of the cookout fixings... Carrots, potatoes and onion with the fried egg perched on top!  Whatever you do... Don't say no to dessert!    The cocktails are trendy, manly and refreshing... All of the local brews you love and some new ones that the bartenders can passionately introduce to you !  The Sow also has a free membership card to rack up the points and ensure your loyalty!

PeJ5KCt7f_Y1nhwjTrUb7w.text: Loved the Duck Fat Fries with 110 minute egg! A lot of the menu items I would never think to order but everything my friends and I tried was really good (including the fried green tomatoes & guacamole!) Great that they use a lot of local ingredients and feature local beers.   Good selection of items on the dinner menu. I was a big fan of the PV Salad - chicken, arugula, kale, spinach, dates, avocado, blue cheese, candied almonds, bacon, and a hard-boiled egg.   Really nice inviting atmosphere and decor. Looks like they have a good happy hour too. I'll be back!

txcuf2WW7jm3XPELKcQyXQ.text: Great GREAT food and wonderful atmosphere.  The bartender Jenna was awesome and fun to chat with.  We split the rare roast beef sandwich and some sort of a pot roast style entree.  Both were insane!  Of course we did the fries which were decadent as can be and split a caramel custard for dessert.  Everything exceeded our expectations.  We'd tried going here once before but it was too crowded.  We like to sit at the bar and you can catch them at a time when there isn't room but that's obviously the sign of a great place.  Wonderful open concept kitchen where you can see them cooking everything and the deck has heaters and a WONDERFUL fireplace.    Love this place.  You will too.

uLJVY3yef40jnLbcJ_VKIg.text: We got there just under 1 hour before closing time. We were worried that that we might get turned away, or that service would not be good, as often times restaurants start the cleanup process early. But we were pleasantly surprised at how accommodating they were, and the good service. I had to be shoulder, and my ride had the pork. The beef shoulder was served and a skillet-like dish. The beef was set a time a helping of mashed potatoes with gravy. This created a stew like effect, which was very tasty.  we also had their version of a Moscow Mule, and a dark beer. All in all, it was a great experience.

Vv8PM2dSUqHKWXPqNIqWUw.text: I read a lot of great reviews for this place especially about the food. The atmosphere was very nice and the decor clean lines and trendy. The food wasn't what I expected I know this sounds silly but it was truly salty I couldn't drink enough water that evening to satisfy my thirst. I did love the guacamole and chips best I ever had. I had the slow roasted pork as the main and it was a little on the cool side. Tender but overly salty. It was a challenge choosing something on the menu. I will go back for cocktails and the entertainment was great. But overall not my place for food. But do try for yourself.

vWBRjc33bhcP7wUi6IFNzw.text: A fabulous and diverse menu with a pork centered theme and creative libations. The staff is fun and friendly as well! Be sure to ask for Tori...she's pretty awesome. Making a reservation is a great idea on the weekends. Saltysow.com Enjoy yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Says it all....

qnbGBFAatv6XRq3k07I2Jw.text: I can't believe I just discovered this place! I got the pork shoulder and it was absolutely delicious. I only wish the portions were a little bit bigger. But they make up for the quantity with quality. Also a good selection of drinks on the menu. I can't wait to come back and try some more.

q03n7njJ7fTgYEQEsZElXg.text: One of the best happy hours I've been to in Arizona.  We pretty much ordered the entire HH menu: 1) Truffled delived eggs 2) Duck fat fries 3) Brussels sprout leaves 4) Spit-roasted pork taco 5) Pork belly taco 6) Beef shoulder taco - The fries and the pork tacos were the best.  The food came out quickly and our server was on top of everything despite it being really busy.

IGVeN6mbhpBcngw9BG9NsQ.text: Yes, I am a FAN!   Very Friendly staff from the moment we walked in the door. We did feel a little under dressed, after a day of shopping...however that did not stop us. The decor is nice and the food was amazing. I would highly recommend trying this spot out.  We enjoyed it and will be back for another meal and some more drinks.

5KZNPrtIX8GPyCu8OOHkRQ.text: What a pleasant find this place is.  We had a variety of things.  The kids menu was good with burgers but the adult offerings were more than just the sow advertised.  I had the trio of the filet, duck and halibut.  My wife had the salmon.  We had the Brussels sprouts.  They were excellent.    To top it off we had the beignets for desert and they were a favorite with the kids... And the adults!  Will be one of our mainstays.

Q2mPJLT08geDN5WOMUYCiQ.text: I had the pleasure of having dinner for the first time at the Salty Sow on Thursday. Our party of 14 had just come from an event, love the ambiance, great menu items (I had trouble deciding!), "Kelly", our server, was spectacular in taking care of all of us.  We had as an appetizer - Crispy Brussel Sprout Leaves...it's a must order (before this...I would have said I don't like brussel sprouts!)  I had the Crispy Chicken Thighs and my daughter had the Sunbru Beer Battered Fish & Chips - both incredible.  I would go back...no question!  Kudos to the Chef & Gen. Mgr :)

SPnSRgWarGJiYC-GXLNOtA.text: Salty Sow definitely stands out amongst the Red Lobster/Olive Garden/Outback variety in the PV mall area. The cuisine is a great blend of comfort food, upscale items, and fresh/local ingredients. We have been coming here a few times a month since it opened and have yet to be disappointed!  They have a great $5 happy hour everyday from 4-6:30 pm with items like fried honey rosemary chicken with a sweet potato biscuit, crispy brussel sprout hash, green chili pork stew, and duck fat fries...yes!  They have a unique selection of cocktails and have $2 off HH specials on those too.   A favorite salad of mine is the PV salad with kale, grilled chicken, dates, avocado, bleu cheese, bacon and candied almonds.  Salty Sow has a great vibe with brick walls, unique lighting and a large rectangular bar. They have live music certain nights on their outdoor patio that we are still able to enjoy when it's 100 degrees outside :)  If you go on a weekend night, I suggest you get a reservation! Even the bar is packed most nights and the high tables around the bar are often reserved.   This place is a great gem in the PV mall neighborhood and I hope it stays that way!

yK-Y2Tc40XMSElkz-tpW0Q.text: Love this place. Can be loud when it's busy but lots of cool decor to look at and usually great music. They sometimes have live music on the patio, and a separate  happy hour menu which makes this a great spot to meet friends. Never had anything that I didn't like but some favs are the happy hour fried chicken, roast beef sandwich, and the green chili appetizer with fresh tortillas. Michael is the best server always remembers us and always great service.

ugtwJrhygqj81xKXbkgwWg.text: I came here with a friend and we ordered their duck fries as an appetizer, which was amazing! Now for our entrees, I ordered the rare roast beef French dip and my friend ordered their crispy chicken thighs. My rare roast beef was truly amazing and the meat was so juicy, tender and full of flavors! However, the mash potatoes that came as a side dish wasn't anything special. I took a bite from my friend's plate and felt that his dish was way too salty.   Dessert: We ordered a chocolate mousse with berries and some lemon bar with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I wasn't a big fan of their chocolate mousse dessert because it tasted very thick and rich. On this plate, it had strawberries, blueberries and some berry jelly smear. The jelly smear had a bitter taste to it and didn't go too well with the chocolate mousse. On the other hand, the lemon bar was edible I shall say. It was very tart and went well with the ice cream. The taste was similar to a key lime pie but obviously made with lemons.   Overall, the food was good and the place is very nice. It was nice listening to the live band playing on their patio. Service was okay just because our waiter seemed impatient and was in a rush. He was very short with his answers when we asked him questions and toward the end of the night, he asked us to hurry up and pay the tab because he was cut. Such a nice way to end a good night, NOT.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So delicious!!! Duck fried fries
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rare roast beef. So bomb!!
Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rare roast beef with onion dip and crispy chicken thighs

wnAT02yRNz_KsqSvsserWA.text: Amazing! The food choice are great, our meal was terrific, sides & desert were terrific. I was floored by how the delicious and creative food.

Dv6DtkhssoEo0Xzp7hHZAw.text: What I like about this place is it's uniqueness. Situated in a weird location between Walmart and Tilted Kilt you wouldn't expect an upscale place like this. That being said, since its upscale, beware it is pricey for sure. It can cost around $100 for 2 ppl b/c portions are small. The items I had were either hit or miss, but boy were the hits good. They try to order locally which is good and everything seemed really fresh. I had 4 peaks peach ale (which is delicious) and a pomegranite mixer drink that was also very refreshing and  tasty. We got their french fries which had eggs on top-good, but the tarragon dipping sauce was bad (like pine needles). I also had the braised pork with mashed potatoes -simply delicious with perfectly tender cooked meat. The salmon was also perfectly cooked with a nice crust on top, but I wasn't crazy about the sauce it came with -blah and fatty tasting. The desert (fried cheesecake and ice cream) was delicious, but not as unique as the rest of the meal I've had it at other places for less and just as good.

W_5ujH3h6CtmUq15-3INbQ.text: This place had a lot of pork type stuff (of course you knew that). So, bring one of the minority that isn't huge into bacon or pork, I had a long look at the menu before deciding on a burger for my dinner. It was good and very tasty, but the flavors are extremely savory. So you must be ready for that and possibly have a glass of water or something light to drink and not a heavy beer (which I ordered, of course). Alas, it was a decent date night place but not on my favorites list.

zdbF4saAIldJoRKgGMPjzg.text: Jeff H  absolutely horrible we were the only people there at 4:00 for happy hour we were seated and then waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if we wanted a drink what a joke !!!! And the manager wouldn't even show his face they need to leave our state and keep their crappy restaurant in texass !!

iv2PxSuiDuOYF0ytgYQPwg.text: Delicious place for foodies to go! Interesting menu with great specials that change daily!!

Nqv8bc-uDnMyNFI3ly1tqQ.text: First time we went here we found a strange menu and tiny expensive weak drinks. Second time the service was not good so we left after spending $15 on 2 tiny weak drinks. Tried it again last night - we had a coupon for a free entree. $75 for a brussel sprout salad that was so tough it hurt my jaw - yes it was salad - halibut that was soggy & had a topping that tasted like bile, broccolini that was lukewarm & also tough, my boyfriends "steak" wasnt even steak it was roast beef & served in a cookpot instead of a normal plate. What the point of that was, was beyond us. That and 4 drinks. So for $75 we got a salad, one entree & 4 drinks. The atmosphere was the only thing we like about the place.

sGpTNy-MEX7lOYQHnBRAfw.text: Like Crystal says "Just go to happy hour" Thats because the $ per ounce of food here is astronomical.  Beef shoulder is tasty($16), pretty small though. They serve it in a cooking pan with the veggies and taters, which are also 'lil nibbles.  Got the deviled eggs, good stuff. So good that I ordered another round after I mowed down the entree like it was an appetizer.($6+$6=$12)  My lady got the petite bone-in filets, which were tasty.($14? I think) She was going to get the pork shoulder but it had white beans in the sauce and they wont leave them out. Kinda weird, but whatevs.  Might go back for happy hour....

5oIaC_U8y5FOnHuua6DIjw.text: I have been here with my family several times. The staff is always pleasant and the food is delicious. Duck fat fries, pork belly, crispy chicken thighs are all wonderful. This is my favorite restaurant in the area.

gElaZNdch0dKL0qHYJmFig.text: Stopped here for a light dinner  and was not disappointed!  The roasted beet salad and the shaved Brussels sprout salad were amazing!  Also shared the truffled deviled eggs and the duck fat fries.   Get the eggs -  they are delicious but the fries were nothing to write home about.

A39xCA70FbO6cLTP-Cm2SQ.text: The food was amazing and unexpected! The service was top notch! The place was slammed and everything came out on time. Our server Jackie was great!!!

qWOHAGEnsuh1uDQV6-Ijkw.text: I tried to make reservations for Mother's Day a week in advance and the person who answered the phone said they weren't taken reservations. We were going to be a party of 6-8 with my elderly parents and I figured it would be better to have reservations since I had family from out of town and I knew they had limited seating for handi-capped since I have been to the Resturant twice and liked the food. We're told they did take reservations when we got there way before the rush but they could not accommodate us since all the seating that was available was high tops obviously not good for elderly people to jump on to. They were not curtious about it at all. Maybe the staff should be better informed and also learn better manners.

AHXXqKiQN-hDbnaITyauBg.text: I have eaten here about 5 times. The food is good but the service is quite frustrating. It starts off great and then the service goes downhill. Refills for drinks are impossible and when they deliver the food it is impossible to ask for a condiment because the server just disappears. Once they up-sale cocktails and appetizers, the friendly service is gone. The last 3 times we could not get out in under 2 1/2 hours and never got a refill for the non-alcoholic drinks and waited over half hour for the check. We finally had to trap a different server to PLEASE find our server to get our check. Frustrating. I've stopped going and when asked I have suggested another restaurant where my business is valued. I feel that 5 visits is enough.  By the way I always tip over 20%, was a server, and genuinely never complain about service unless it's warranted. Service has to be good start to finish, not up until the order is taken.

4Yq2vBp0Jyyn5reXC6IaMw.text: I have been visiting The Sow since they opened, generally the food is delicious. However, recently their food quality has gone down.  I ordered the fried chicken and biscuits, and the chicken was not completely cooked.  Additionally, the roast beef sandwich was not as rare as I remember it being which was disappointing because that is one of the non-modifiable items.  That sandwich had so much more flavor when it was nice and rare.  The tacos on the lunch and happy hour menu are still the best for continuous quality.

1us-Itz8ZnzmMyT36EWIwg.text: Highly disappointed with this place. I just attempted to eat here. Hostess sat us. 30 min later still no drink order. Still nothing. Just had to finally get up and leave. That is sad because we were repeat customers. Sorry Salty Sow.... Won't be visiting you ever again.

YQvvMlb5GxROWTa7XU_jEA.text: We loved the Salty Sow!  Great food, service, cocktails & atmosphere!  This was our first time & we will definitely be back.  The deviled eggs were delicious.  We tried the tuna & pork prime rib.  Both were fantastic.  My favorite new cocktail is the salty sow'r - bourbon / lime juice - incredible!  We loved the side dishes too.  Great spot to meet friends too!

Gw-UifatRKrA1RtfyxkIUg.text: Awesome restaurant! Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Happy hour is definitely the way to go! The deviled eggs are so creamy and so tasty! The fried chicken and biscuits were seasoned perfectly. You cannot go wrong with any of the choices on the menu everything is great! I definitely recommend everyone trying this place out, you will not be disappointed!

8ZrvkxuSRd7wi5Ye9Pmk9w.text: This has been our go-to neighborhood eatery for almost 2 years. It is one of the best restaurants, if not the best restaurant, for miles around. The ambiance is warm and lively, with a dynamic, feel-good vibe and good, live music on the weekends. The dishes are creative and tasty. And this isn't just trendy, creative, unhealthy fare... There is something for everyone. The happy hour is a good value. The clientele is upscale but not pretentious. The staff is friendly. The hostesses are absolute gems and as helpful as can be - especially in having to deal with high demand at peak times. The specialty drinks are creative. Several of the servers and bartenders are highly professional and helpful. Others... less so. I am stopping short of giving the Salty a 5 because, in our many times there, there have been some areas of improvement. These include the service not being as good as what we have come to expect, certain areas of the restaurant being too loud, too crowded or too hot, and the kitchen running out of signature dishes - sometimes even early on in the evening. Again, a few areas of improvement over our many visits. And mostly related to the high demand on this place. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Imo21wAUnrxIxhKJRo5W_A.text: As a native Texan, I find this place reminds me of home.  Their collard greens are better than my Grandmother's.  The pork belly is OMG amazing.  Love the unique cocktails with my favorite being the Curly Tail which has chili peppers frozen into the ice cube so your drink gets spicier as you drink it.  The PV Salad is easily one of the best salads I have ever eaten in my life.  Outstanding service, delicious food, casual yet upscale vibe.  What's not to love?

t70GFH9Z3cswSFbk0yWN1w.text: Great food, great atmosphere. I would come back next time in phoenix. You must try the duck fat fries and stuffed mushrooms.

KZePgCvD-1bN9BKhwCqjiA.text: I went here a few weeks ago and really loved the ambiance.  Though our stuffed mushrooms did not come out until after our meals were placed before us...well worth the wait.  YUM!  Our waiter was apologetic and pretty awesome overall.  A touch too much butter on the fish but our waiter was quick to bring me lots of lemon to cut through that issue.  Overall, I really enjoyed this fun, hip pig adorned establishment.  Texas gal felt happy and right at home.  TVs for golf and games, live band.  The staff from entery to exit...great energy.  Look forward to many yummy dining experiences.  Oddly, as we left, it became an insane microburst that soaked us to the bone in 10 seconds...Salty Sow experience was so good all this gal could do was dry down with a golf towle, wipe away the mascara, forget I was dry clean only and laugh my Salty Sow hiney off.  High to the Hog recommend for great food, fab staff and an overall great time.  Only thing that could have made it better?  Complimentary umbrellas!  It WAS raining pigs y'all!!!!  :)  YUM!!!!

AEA1LMZPqtvtIk-txymdAQ.text: This restaurant impressed me so much for dinner that I came for happy hour a week later. On our first visit, our server, Mason was great - extremely friendly and attentive!   The restaurant was busy and had so much energy! My fubby and I ordered white sangrias and it was amazing! I highly recommend especially since drinking half the glass, I was already feeling the alcohol! I loved their Brussels sprouts and lamb burger! They were so delicious! We also ordered the duck fries - the lamb burger included fries so I regretted ordering the duck fries because we couldn't even devour half of the fries! It was truly a waste. The duck fries were good, but I wouldn't order them again. Even though they were "duck" fries, they were just fries to me with an egg on top - big whoop. The bill came close to $50 which isn't cheap but I noticed they have happy hour so I knew I would be back!  A week later, we couldn't stop thinking about Salty Sow. Very little do we go to a new place and we like it enough to add to our restaurant list. Congrats Salty, you made it to our list!   We decided to try their happy hour and only ordered happy hour items - it was a big mistake but at least the next time, I know better. We didn't order the lamb burger because it wasn't on the hh menu. Instead, we ordered the Brussels, carnitas taco, fried chicken, chorizo stuffed mushrooms, the eggplant fritters, the catfish taco, and I got a Sedona Sunset drink.   My drink was way too strong that I only managed to get in a few sips. The tacos were $5 each - I mean one big taco for $5 and this is a happy hour price! They were ok but I wouldn't order these again - not for that price. The chorizo stuffed mushrooms again were flavorful but I wasn't a big fan. The fried chicken was good but wouldn't come back just for their fried chicken. And the eggplant fritters was just that - fried eggplant. Our server, Kayla, wasn't that attentive either. She took forever to check on us and give us our check and I don't think the restaurant was more busy than the last time we were there. The check totaled $50.  My lesson: come back and order the Brussels and lamb burger - and a white sangria and if I come during happy hour, stick with that order and the check will be a few dollars cheaper because of the Brussels and sangria!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprouts, Chicken Thighs, and a double cheeseburger with fries

0sfIlbBCKDtkxO1RGdbQ1w.text: The best buffet, chefs were so kind and funny! I hope their treated well and the servers too. Great energy. The food was loaded with so much flavor. I don't eat a lot of pork, but I compromised. The food outstanding the biscuits were bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

N6XTh_xm6Lzjpoz7NgVTpQ.text: Great food! Friendly staff.  The beef is one of my favorite dishes, while of course the pork entree is perfect!

BnU6QZHxgxIKqZW16lZmtA.text: It was our first time there so we tried a bit of many things. The food was all served piping hot and fresh. It was overall a good place to dine and I could see it being a local favorite. We did make reservations though they weren't needed at the time we arrived. It was fun to see inside the kitchen and the server was kind.

ndHDh6pBGQj2UJwqYriCZw.text: I go to Salty Sow pretty frequently, but I recently had a birthday celebration there, with 16 others and wanted to update my review. Of course, I already knew the food would be great and they didn't disappoint! I love the happy hour rosemary chicken and we asked if we could place an order the day before for 10 of them and they had no problem with it! The service was fantastic, everyone was so helpful and tried to get things to us in a timely manner. I definitely recommend!!! Get the happy hour fried chicken!!!!!!

nsuSRFuN8AnonNsLnoGYfA.text: So many great plates to select from, the only problem is that some servers are absolutely amazing and others are just average.  I have always loved this place for the style and the extra special something that you can not find elsewhere. The salty sow French dip and the Brussel Sprout Cesar with Chicken.  Also recommended fat duck fries oh yum yum!

T2q5YIagQzMTUmoj1IDy3w.text: One of the better out of state 'corporate' restaurants.  The innovative menu, hipster vibe, and commitment to the community all justify a place alongside the locally bred and loved options.  Some great comfort food options but also a shout out for some innovative side dishes like the pastrami salmon and white corn cheese girts.

tHYgeloyH42VfyYmyxLk4g.text: Absolutely amazing food and drinks. The best sangria I have ever had. However the service is a hit or miss depending if you go on a week day versus the weekend.

GIhNscgzD5uC6ddjugRc_w.text: Found this place on accident looking for a dessert spot and decided on it for the namesake alone. Ended up with desert first, two appetizers and an entree later - everything was amazing. Nothing disappointed. We are Tucson natives and will be making the 2hr commute to come back, that is certain. Had deviled eggs, chicken on a stick, pork chop stack and cheesecake in a jar. No regrets!

sl-PdBMIIhSlT4IDa5l_OQ.text: We love this restaurant and go quite often. I usually have their French dip and duck fat fries. The BEST!

qZO3QAVAEtu7T7Cry32mXg.text: During October 2017 lunch is BOGO. We split the double cheese burger and Salty Sow French Dip. The French Dip was double rare and completely tasteless. There wasn't even a hint of the horseradish sauce, which I love with this entree. The cheeseburger gave me Whopper indigestion. The duck fat fries were good, but I couldn't detect the duck fat. Maybe some of my well worn taste buds are as dead as Jacob Marley. One star for ambiance, one star for service and one star for value. It's definitely worth trying with the BOGO lunch. We may return and try 2 other entrees.

1D9DEF9tVfXydEJww1qYYA.text: Great spot for lunch. I come here with my wife on a regular basis. I heard they have live music which is great. We need to check it out. My wife is vegan and this spot has several good vegan dishes. Keep up the good work. We can't wait to see you guys again.

IMEFClHL89hqt-HeXR0pJA.text: First time dining there with some close friends. Tried the Rosemary deep fried chicken  with biscuit. This was on the Happy hour menu and the biscuit is delicious, kinda doughy, nice subtle hint of herbs. Chicken was juicy and a solid crunch on the Rosemary breading. However, in the bottom of the dish was a syrup-like liquid which was Very disappointing and not speaking to the more savory flavors of the dish.  I asked for the chicken pieces and biscuit to be removed and placed on a dry plate, however, both the corn and biscuit were impregnated with that syrupy liquid.  Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals however.  To order again, delete that pervasive liquid is get on the side to control the amount absorbed.

vWO_KIM_AO_y4UTcV6Fsmg.text: We found this on Yelp and decided to give it a try. We were seated right away at 5:30 on a Friday night. We had the truffled deviled eggs to start. They were wonderful without being loaded with weird ingredients like pickles or pimento. My husband had one of their summer specials, a cold soba noodle salad which he polished off. I had the beef shoulder.  It was very tender and served with Yukon mashed potatoes. We finished with the butterscotch budino and a creme brulee. Both were perfect. Two reasons this isn't a 5 Star review. The root veggies with the beef shoulder were sweet and didn't do much for me. The same with the fried egg on top. Also we waited quite a while for our appetizer and once we got it we had just started to dig in when our entrees were served. But we would go again and would love to have Kaitlin as our server. Overall very good time!

90oWmtJvE9TF4Vczyezj2A.text: Hands down one of my favorite places to eat! Excellent service, chill ambiance, and GREAT food!! Only my second time here, but from the first time I came here, I knew this would easily be my favorite place to eat. They have daily happy hour from 4pm to 630pm & we mostly ordered from this menu on this particular visit. Had their crispy brussels sprouts leaves.. holy crap! I cant say enough about this dish.. the absolute best, I wish I could have it everyday lol. I have to give a shout out to our server Holly cause she was so pleasant! Very friendly and attentive. Love this place!

p1Gx_ZkJsUxsGpzxPVqygA.text: My husband took me here for Mother's Day last year. It was a nice atmosphere. My only complaint was that it was pretty loud. We will probably try it again at some point when it's not a holiday.

3NeCxCzc8_ITVH_X88Jn1g.text: The food is outstanding! The environment is what you would expect from a Gastropub. I had the fish tacos, my wife had the prime rib! Both were fantastic. The menu had tons of awesome selections, it was difficult to choose! Awesome selection of beer! I enjoyed a limited time IPA. We live in the neighborhood and plan on coming back.

_hTbe7k1kflmGpTwnFIavQ.text: This was my 2nd visit to Salty Sow and looking back through things, it has been 3 years since last time I was here.   I will not wait so long next time.  Great grub, great drinks, great atmosphere, great service.  Simple.   Check it out.

lcZaevqp5jgvjMd8Wy74sA.text: My husband picked this place from yelp. When we arrived we were told that they only serve brunch buffet from 10am to 2 pm on Sundays. I wasn't looking for breakfast, but we had driven 34 Miles, so we decided to stay.  Very glad we did. We tried the roast pork loin stuffed with chorizo sausage, honey rosemary fried chicken, hot smoked salmon, fresh fruit and berries, Brussels sprout Caesar salad, fried green tomatoes, roasted beets, and a mimosa for me. We also hit the dessert bar. Everything was good quality, freshly prepared, and very tasty. Our server, Zack took great care of us, and we had a fun conversation. All the employees seemed very friendly. $19.95 for all you can eat We will be back to try the lunch menu.

o6sSo4tMh3R_iQmiRpVQCw.text: First time here and my husband were super excited to try it out.  The place is beautiful, ambiance is great, our waiter was very nice.  The food was not what I expected, the menu items don't flow (look them over and I will understand). We had the pork tacos and I would suggest serving them on a corn tortilla, the Duck fat fries were not exactly the bomb, the salad was warm.  The wine glass was dirty and the waiter didn't even poor the wine.  I can say we will not be back as our first experience was not one to remember.  Always on the hunt for a great meal!

JHpymIEeyZ-B19PO1l86RA.text: Food was great. We were a party of four and ordered the pork belly (3/5), French dip (4/5), ribeye tacos (4/5) and the hot chicken sandwich (5/5). This chicken sandwich was, no joke, the largest chicken sandwich we've ever seen. And very, very good.   The service was great. Only downfall was that the happy hour was only in the bar area and there were no seats or tables in the bar area.   Great ambiance and a nice menu. The banana foster beignets were absolutely amazing. Would recommend saving room for those. Party of four split an order.

WddjKcRgB6PyXSECKpZMDA.text: I cannot say enough for the Salty. It's in my hood and the bartender knows my drink. Salty does a mean happy hour, has nightly specials and offers a few choice desserts. Then, there is that massive hunk of juicy prime rib with the best crust in the business sweltering under a lamp and begging you to drag a piece through the best horseradish creme ever.  I love every damn thing on the menu. It's casual but severs up  foodie-worthy fare and highbrow drinks in a great environment.  There are 10 sit down restaurants in this area and I only go to two, and only one regularly. You guessed it...i strap on the hog.

krCCi_-mkutgAztHKi1leA.text: This place gives me mixed feelings. On the one hand, the food is extremely fresh and of good quality. But on the other hand, some items seemed over priced and bland. I think proper ordering is key at this restaurant. Unfortunately, I am only about 60/40 when it comes to ordering well. So on my visit, only one out four in my party ordered decently, and even they didn't rave about the food... Therefore, I am happy to have tried this restaurant and glad to have crossed it off my must try list... But will I return? Unlikely.  I will say, the service was strong, the food was fast, and the restaurant was clean. Like sterile clean. Which I loved! Had the food been a bit more tantalizing I may have given it 5 stars. Also, their bar poured us some weak cocktails, and that was a disappointment as they were not cheap. Oddly enough, they started getting stronger in the last round.   I had ordered a $16.00 French dip, which was a perfect mid-rare, yay!, But bland, tough, and a bit small for the price. This sandwiches was so tough in fact, that I could only eat half because I was too tired from chewing to eat there rest... The duck fat fries were neither crispy or soggy, or flavorful. May I recommend using beef tallow?!? The green chili nachos are a great thought but smallish and the only flavor comes from the jalapenos.   All in all, it was about and hour from closing when we arrived, so maybe we had slim pickings left of the ingredients, and maybe that is why the food was average.... Either way we spent $135.00 for 4 people for a simple Friday night meal with a few drinks, I think it should have been better.

Xum4t4VwjdT0uG2nBfkmTQ.text: My husband and I came here for a date night/dinner and drinks. I got the old fashion (DELICIOUS!) and my husband got a mule. We wanted a healthy/light meal and unfortunately everything on the menu looked SO good but nothing was "light". We ordered an appetizer, the bruschetta. Which we were expecting to be a fresh tomato dish with bread and it was actually a dill cheese smothered on ciabatta with dates and honey drizzle. It wasn't the light dish we were looking for but it was DELICIOUS. We devoured it and it's probably my favorite dish of all time!  I highly recommend for drinks and delicious food, although not for a light meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Sow - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta

hiZGo59MBnAs489JOWyFxw.text: This is one of my favorite new restaurants in town. I was in Phoenix couple weeks ago and invited some friends to have dinner over the weekend. Great food, appetizers and specifically the dessert. I can't remember the name of the dessert plate but it was super delicious.

dzgen7hgokwVijIxA_5kRw.text: Amazing food great prices, service was prompt and friendly, definitely will be coming back!

prGkyEFCIn_gJ_zdztmQ6A.text: Once upon a time, I was hungry and that's what happened to your food here at Salty Sow. There is no we in food, just me. It's hard to want to share the food here. You want to keep it to yourself. Where do I start from the white sangria to the rosemary fried chicken and the choices of truffled deviled eggs and cracklin' duroc pork belly? I mean you come here so that you can fall off every single diet. Diets are ridiculously starving you of great food here.   My favorite time here is lunch, happy hour and dinner. Why not? Great atmosphere, great service, great menu choices. If I could sit here all day and dine, I probably would but then my friends may think I have been kidnapped. The restaurant is always busy because it's a great date spot, happy hour meetup and even a casual dinner with the neibs. And I hear they have a killer Sunday brunch that I am going to have to check off. If you are still hungry from the list I rattled off earlier, have some duck fat fries to tie you over or order my other fave combo of the brussels sprouts and lamb burger. Anyone can get fit for the new year eating that delishness. And somewhat without guilt. I won't be impressed with technology until I can download food from here. Since it is my neighborhood spot, you'll see me often so come say hi.
